Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 11, 2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Chin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of Janauary 11, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Salvatore Scibetta, to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the New York City Board of Standards and Appeals, pursuant to Section 31 and 659 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Salvatore Scibetta, Board of Standards and Appeals

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Department of Housing Preservation and Development - Submitting Letter from the United Stated Bureau of the Census containing results of the 2017 New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS) as well as the Selected Initial Findings of the 2017 HVS prepared by HPD’s Division of Research and Evaluation Pursuant to subdivision 3 of Section 1 of the Local Emergency Housing Rent Control Act.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: 2017 NYC Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2018.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of NY continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2018.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United State Supreme Court to protect public sector collective bargaining in Janus v. American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: US Supreme Court to protect public sector collective bargaining in Janus v. American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting businesses from setting a minimum purchase requirement greater than $10 for credit card transactions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting businesses from setting a minimum purchase requirement greater than $10 for credit card transactions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all city-owned buildings be powered by green energy sources by 2050
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all city-owned buildings be powered by green energy sources by 2050.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports on the enforcement of marijuana possession.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to submit reports on the enforcement of marijuana possession.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the fire department to conduct outreach and education to residential buildings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring notice to close doors when escaping a fire
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Requiring notice to close doors when escaping a fire.

Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Requirements for smoke alarms and smoke detectors in residential and non-residential occupancies.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Self-closing doors

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to stove knob covers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Stove knob covers

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the fire department to implement a plan for educating both children and parents about fire safety and prevention
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Requiring the FDNY to implement a plan for educating both children and parents about fire safety and prevention.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency evacuation preparedness for individuals with disabilities or limited mobility
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Emergency evacuation preparedness for individuals with disabilities or limited mobility.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the fire department to meet certain standards for fire hydrant inspections and report on fire hydrant inspection results
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Fire Safety Package - Requiring the fire department to meet certain standards for fire hydrant inspections and report on fire hydrant inspection results.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain reporting on an affordable housing plan

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, H.R. 4937, which would provide immigration relief for New York resident Ravidath “Ravi” Lawrence Ragbir and denouncing the unlawful targeting of immigrant rights activists for deportation by the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their opposition to this item:  
Council Members Borelli, Diaz, Gjonaj, Holden, Ulrich, Yeger, and Matteo.

The following Council Member formally noted his abstention from voting on this item:  
Council Member Deutsch.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Provide immigration relief for NY resident Ravidath “Ravi” Lawrence Ragbir.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 43 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.
